lead_paragraph: LACHER--Michael, 75, on April 1, 2016. Beloved husband of Judith (nee) Weller. Father of Mark Tennenbaum, Andrew R. Tennenbaum and Nicholas Lacher. Grandfather of Christopher and Frederick Tennenbaum. Brother of Susan Weintraub and brother-in-law of Joseph. Born and raised in Brooklyn, Michael graduated from Stuyvesant High School, Hunter College and Brooklyn Law School. He spent his early years working for United States Senators Kenneth B. Keating and Jacob K. Javits, and rose to Legislative Counsel to New York City Mayor John V. Lindsay. Michael was an international Corporate Lawyer for 50+ years and a partner at Eaton and Van Winkle LLP in New York City. For the last decade, Michael was a leading legal advocate in Holocaust art recovery. Michael was known to all as the ultimate raconteur, loyal friend and loving husband and father. And, it doesn't get any better than that. In lieu of flowers, the family asks donations be made to Southern Poverty Law Center or the ASPCA. Funeral Service Tuesday, 11:00am at Frank E. Campbell (at 81st St.) Interment to follow. 1/3
